translated: Abhidharma-jÃ±Äna-prasthÄna-Å›Ästra, fascicle 5
Composed by Venerable KÄtyÄyanÄ«putra
Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on imperial commandğŸ”½Sudden and gradual, bondage and liberation,
Fruits subsumed, seven become threeğŸ”½Death and rebirth, not six kinds
I wish to fully explain this chapter
Each of the three realms has two types of bonds, namely:
Those eliminated by seeing and those eliminated by cultivation.
Are there any who suddenly become bound by the two types of bonds eliminated by seeing and cultivation in the desire realm?
Answer:
There are.
Namely:

Ordinary beings who have already become detached from the desire realm, when falling back from detachment from the desire realm, and when passing away from the form and formless realms and being reborn in the desire realm.
Are there any who suddenly become liberated?
Answer:
There are.
Namely:
When ordinary beings become detached from the desire realm.
Are there any who gradually become bound?
Answer:
There are none.
Are there any who gradually become liberated?
Answer:
There are.
Namely:
The disciples of the World-Honored One first sever the bonds to be severed by seeing, and later sever the bonds to be severed by cultivation.
Are there any who suddenly become bound to the two categories of bonds to be severed by seeing and cultivation in the form realm?
Answer:
There are.
Namely,

ordinary beings who have already severed attachment to the form realm, when falling back from the severance of attachment to the form realm, and when passing away from the formless realm and being reborn in the desire or form realms.
Are there any who suddenly sever the bonds?
Answer:
There are.
Namely,
ordinary beings when severing attachment to the form realm.
Are there any who gradually become bound?
Answer:
There are none.
Are there any who gradually sever the bonds?
Answer:
There are.
Namely,
the disciples of the World-Honored One first sever the bonds to be severed by seeing, and later sever the bonds to be severed by cultivation.
Are there any who suddenly become bound to the two categories of bonds to be severed by seeing and cultivation in the formless realm?
Answer:
There are none.
Are there any who suddenly sever the bonds?
Answer:
There are none.
Can one gradually attain bondage?
Answer:
No.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½
Can one gradually become free from bondage?
Answer:
Yes.
This means:
The disciples of the World-Honored One first become free from the bonds to be severed by seeing, and later become free from the bonds to be severed by cultivation.
To what fruit does the exhaustion of the bonds to be severed by seeing in the desire realm belong?
Answer:
To the four fruits of the religious life, or to no abode.
To what fruit does the exhaustion of the bonds to be severed by cultivation in the desire realm belong?
Answer:
To the fruit of non-returner or arhat, or to no abode.
To what fruit does the exhaustion of the bonds to be severed by seeing in the form realm belong?
Answer:
To the four fruits of the religious life, or to no abode.
To what fruit does the exhaustion of the bonds to be severed by cultivation in the form realm belong?
Answer:
To the fruit of arhatship, or to no abode.
To what fruit does the exhaustion of the bonds to be severed by seeing in the formless realm belong?
Answer:
To the four fruits of the religious life.
To what fruit does the exhaustion of the bonds to be severed by cultivation in the formless realm belong?
Answer:
the fruit of arhatship.
There are five types of bonds, namely:
the bonds to be eliminated by seeing suffering... up to the bonds to be eliminated by cultivation.
The elimination of the bonds to be eliminated by seeing suffering, which fruit does it include?
Answer:
the four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a, or it may be that there is no [fruit that includes it].
The elimination of the bonds to be eliminated by seeing the accumulation, which fruit does it include?
Answer:
the four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a, or it may be that there is no [fruit that includes it].
The elimination of the bonds to be eliminated by seeing cessation, which fruit does it include?
Answer:
the four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a, or it may be that there is no [fruit that includes it].
The elimination of the bonds to be eliminated by seeing the path, which fruit does it include?
Answer:
the four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a.
The elimination of the bonds to be eliminated by cultivation, which fruit does it include?
Answer:
the fruit of arhatship.
There are nine types of bonds.
Namely:
the bonds to be eliminated by the knowledge of the truth of suffering... up to the bonds to be eliminated by cultivation.
The elimination of the bonds to be eliminated by the knowledge of the truth of suffering, which fruit does it include?
Answer:
the four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a, or it may be that there is no [fruit that includes it].
The abandonment of the fetters eliminated by the knowledge of the class of suffering up to the knowledge of the law of the path, in which fruit are they included?
Answer:
The four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a, or they may not be included anywhere.
The abandonment of the fetters eliminated by the knowledge of the class of the path, in which fruit are they included?
Answer:
The four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a.
The abandonment of the fetters eliminated by cultivation, in which fruit are they included?
Answer:
The fruit of arhatship.
There are fifteen kinds of fetters, namely, each of the three realms has five kinds:
The fetters eliminated by seeing suffering... up to the fetters eliminated by cultivation.
The abandonment of the fetters eliminated by seeing suffering, origination, cessation, and the path in the desire realm, in which fruit are they included?
Answer:
The four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a, or they may not be included anywhere.
The abandonment of the fetters eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm, in which fruit are they included?
Answer:
The fruit of non-returner and arhat, or they may not be included anywhere.
The abandonment of the fetters eliminated by seeing suffering, origination, cessation, and the path in the form realm, in which fruit are they included?
Answer:
The four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a, or they may not be included anywhere.
The abandonment of the fetters to be eliminated by cultivation in the form realm, in which stage are they included?
Answer:
They are included in the fruit of arhatship, or they are not included.
The abandonment of the fetters to be eliminated by seeing suffering, origination, and cessation in the formless realm, in which fruit are they included?
Answer:
They are included in the four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a, or they are not included.
The abandonment of the fetters to be eliminated by seeing the path in the formless realm, in which fruit are they included?
Answer:
They are included in the four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a.
The abandonment of the fetters to be eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm, in which fruit are they included?
Answer:
They are included in the fruit of arhatship.
The abandonment of each of the three fetters up to the ninety-eight latent afflictions, in which fruit are they included?
Answer:
The abandonment of the view of the aggregates as real in the three fetters is included in the four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a, or it is not included.
Just as the abandonment of the view of the aggregates as real in the three fetters should be understood,

so too is the abandonment of the view of the aggregates as real and the view grasping extremes among the five lower fetters, and among the five views, the abandonment of the view of the aggregates as real and the view grasping extremes.
The exhaustion of the grasping of precepts and vows and doubt are subsumed by the four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a.
As for the exhaustion of the grasping of precepts and vows and doubt among the three bonds, one should understand:

As for the view flood and yoke, among the four floods and yokes, the grasping of views and the grasping of precepts and vows, among the four graspings, the grasping of precepts and vows and the body tie of grasping this as true, among the four body ties, the grasping of precepts and vows and doubt, among the five lower fetters, the wrong view, view of grasping, and grasping of precepts and vows, among the five views, the view and doubt entanglements, among the seven entanglements, and the view, grasping, and doubt bonds, among the nine bonds, the exhaustion of these are also like this.
The exhaustion of the three unwholesome roots is subsumed by the fruit of non-returner and arhat, or it has no place.
As for the exhaustion of the three unwholesome roots, one should understand:

Among the three bonds, the desire bond, among the four floods and yokes, the desire flood and yoke, among the four graspings, the desire grasping, among the four ties, sensual desire and ill will, among the five hindrances, the first four hindrances, among the five lower fetters, ill will, envy, and stinginess, among the five fetters associated with the lower realm, sensual desire and ill will, among the six bases of contact, the nose and tongue contact-born craving, among the seven latent afflictions, desire-attachment and ill will, among the nine fetters, the fetters of anger, envy, and stinginess - are also like this.
The abandonment of the existence bond and ignorance bond is included in the fruit of arhatship.
Just as there is the abandonment of the existence bond and ignorance bond, one should know that...

In the four floods and graspings, the floods and graspings of existence and ignorance, in the four graspings, the grasping of doctrines of self, in the five bonds, the bonds of craving and pride, in the five higher bonds, except for craving for form, the rest.

In the six bases of craving, the base of craving produced by mental contact, in the seven latent afflictions, the latent afflictions of existence, craving, ignorance, and pride, in the nine bonds, the bonds of craving, pride, and ignorance - it is also like this.
The exhaustion of the cover of doubt is included in the four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a, or it has no place.
The exhaustion of the higher bond of craving for form is included in the fruit of arhatship, or it has no place.
Just as the exhaustion of the higher bond of craving for form.
One should know:
The exhaustion of the bases of craving produced by eye, ear, and body contact is also like this.
In the ninety-eight latent afflictions,
The exhaustion of the latent tendencies eliminated by seeing suffering, origin, cessation, and the path in the desire realm is included in the four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a, or there is no place.
The exhaustion of the latent tendencies eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm is included in the fruits of non-returning and arhatship, or there is no place.
The exhaustion of the latent tendencies eliminated by seeing suffering, origin, cessation, and the path in the form realm is included in the four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a, or there is no place.

The exhaustion of the latent tendencies eliminated by cultivation in the form realm is included in the fruit of arhatship, or there is no place.ğŸ”½The exhaustion of the latent tendencies eliminated by seeing suffering, origin, and cessation in the formless realm is included in the four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a, or there is no place.
The exhaustion of the latent tendencies eliminated by seeing the path in the formless realm is included in the four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a.
The exhaustion of the latent tendencies eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm is included in the fruit of arhatship.
The exhaustion of the bonds in the path of the stream-enterer is included in which fruit?
Answer:
There is no place.
The exhaustion of the bonds in the fruit of the stream-enterer is included in which fruit?
Answer:
The fruit of stream-entry.
As for the complete abandonment of all fetters in the path of once-returning, which fruit does it belong to?
Answer:
The fruit of stream-entry, or it may be that there is no [such fruit].
As for the complete abandonment of all fetters in the fruit of once-returning, which fruit does it belong to?
Answer:
The fruit of once-returning.
As for the complete abandonment of all fetters in the path of non-returning, which fruit does it belong to?
Answer:
The fruit of once-returning, or it may be that there is no [such fruit].
As for the complete abandonment of all fetters in the fruit of non-returning, which fruit does it belong to?
Answer:
The fruit of non-returning.
As for the complete abandonment of all fetters in the path of the arhat, which fruit does it belong to?
Answer:
The fruit of non-returning, or it may be that there is no [such fruit].
As for the complete abandonment of all fetters in the fruit of arhatship, which fruit does it belong to?
Answer:
The fruit of arhatship.
The World-Honored One's disciples who have fully seen [the truths]:
As for the complete abandonment of all fetters to be eliminated in the realm of desire through cultivation, which fruit does it belong to?
Answer:
The fruit of once-returning, or it may be that there is no [such fruit].

Having already separated from desire realm defilements, but not yet separated from form realm defilements, the exhaustion of all bonds to be eliminated by cultivation in the form realm is included in which fruit?
Answer:
There is no such case.

Having already separated from form realm defilements, but not yet separated from formless realm defilements, the exhaustion of all bonds to be eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm is included in which fruit?
Answer:
There is no such case.
The conditioned and unconditioned dharmas that are accomplished by the stream-enterers, are these dharmas included in the fruit of stream-enterer?
Answer:
Sometimes they are included, sometimes they are not.
How are they included?
Answer:
The conditioned fruit of stream-enterer that has been attained and not lost.
How are they not included?
Answer:
The conditioned dharmas such as the uncontaminated faculties that are the superior progress attained by the stream-enterers.
If a dharma is included in the fruit of stream-enterer, is this a conditioned dharma of the learner?
Answer:
Sometimes it is a learner's dharma, sometimes it is neither a learner's nor post-learner's dharma.
How is it a learner's dharma?
Answer:
The conditioned fruit of stream-enterer.
How is it neither a learner's nor post-learner's dharma?
Answer:
The unconditioned fruit of stream-entry.
Are the learned dharmas that are possessed by those who are once-returners included in the fruit of once-returning?
Answer:
Sometimes they are included, sometimes they are not.
How are they included?
Answer:
The conditioned fruit of once-returning that has been attained and not lost.
How are they not included?
Answer:
The conditioned dharmas such as the uncontaminated faculties that are the superior progress attained by those who are once-returners.
If a dharma is included in the fruit of once-returning, is it a learned dharma?
Answer:
Sometimes it is learned, sometimes it is neither learned nor unlearned.
How is it learned?
Answer:
The conditioned fruit of once-returning.
How is it neither learned nor unlearned?
Answer:
The unconditioned fruit of once-returning.
Are the learned dharmas that are possessed by those who are non-returners included in the fruit of non-returning?
Answer:
Sometimes they are included, sometimes they are not.
How are they included?
Answer:
The conditioned fruit of non-returning that has been attained and not lost.
How is it not included?
Answer:
The superior and advanced uncontaminated faculties and conditioned dharmas obtained by those who do not return.
If a dharma is included in the fruit of those who do not return, is this a dharma of training?
Answer:
Either of training, or neither of training nor of no training.
How is it of training?
Answer:
The conditioned fruit of those who do not return.
How is it neither of training nor of no training?
Answer:
The unconditioned fruit of those who do not return.
The uncontaminated dharmas accomplished by arhats, are these dharmas included in the fruit of arhatship?
Answer:
So it is.
If a dharma is included in the fruit of arhatship, is this an uncontaminated dharma?
Answer:
Either uncontaminated, or neither of training nor of no training.
How is it uncontaminated?
Answer:
The conditioned fruit of arhatship.
How is it neither of training nor of no training?
Answer:
The unconditioned fruit of arhatship.
Are the uncontaminated dharmas that are possessed by all stream-enterers included in the fruit of stream-entry?
Answer:
They may be included, or they may not be included.
How are they included?
Answer:
The conditioned and unconditioned fruits of stream-entry that have already been attained and are not lost.
How are they not included?
Answer:

The uncontaminated roots, etc., that are the superior progress attained by stream-enterers, the conditioned dharmas, the bonds that have been eliminated by them, and the non-analytical cessation possessed by stream-enterers.
If a dharma is included in the fruit of stream-entry, is it an uncontaminated dharma?
Answer:
It is so.
Are the uncontaminated dharmas that are possessed by all once-returners included in the fruit of once-returning?
Answer:
They may be included, or they may not be included.
How are they included?
Answer:
The conditioned and unconditioned fruits of once-returning that have already been attained and are not lost.
How are they not included?
Answer:

The superior and advanced uncontaminated faculties, etc., conditioned dharmas obtained by those who are once-returners, the bonds that are extinguished by them, and the non-analytical cessation accomplished by once-returners,
If a dharma is included in the fruit of once-returning, is this an uncontaminated dharma?
Answer:
It is so.
The uncontaminated dharmas accomplished by non-returners, are these dharmas included in the fruit of non-returning?
Answer:
They may be included, or not.
How are they included?
Answer:
The conditioned and unconditioned fruits of non-returning, which have been obtained and not lost.
How are they not included?
Answer:

The superior and advanced uncontaminated faculties, etc., conditioned dharmas obtained by non-returners, the bonds that are extinguished by them, and the non-analytical cessation accomplished by non-returners,
If a dharma is included in the fruit of non-returning, is this an uncontaminated dharma?
Answer:
It is so.
The uncontaminated dharmas accomplished by arhats, are these dharmas included in the fruit of arhatship?
Answer:
Sometimes it includes, sometimes it does not.
How does it include?
Answer:
The conditioned and unconditioned arhat fruits that have been attained and not lost.
How does it not include?
Answer:
The non-analytical cessation accomplished by the arhat.
If a dharma is included in the arhat fruit, is it a pure dharma?
Answer:
So it is.
For the dharmas accomplished by the stream-enterer, are these dharmas included in the fruit of the stream-enterer?
Answer:
One should make four alternatives.
There are dharmas accomplished by the stream-enterer that are not included in the fruit of the stream-enterer.
Namely:

The conditioned dharmas such as the superior pure faculties obtained by the stream-enterer, the bonds exhausted that he realizes, and the non-analytical cessations accomplished by the stream-enterer, which are defiled dharmas.
There are dharmas included in the fruit of the stream-enterer that are not accomplished by the stream-enterer.
Namely:
The fruit of the stream-enterer that has not yet been attained or has been lost.
There are dharmas that are possessed by the stream-enterer and also included in the fruit of stream-entry.
Namely:
The fruit of stream-entry that has been attained and not lost.
There are dharmas that are neither possessed by the stream-enterer nor included in the fruit of stream-entry.
Namely:
Excluding the above characteristics.
For all dharmas possessed by the once-returner, are these dharmas included in the fruit of once-returning?
Answer:
Four sentences should be made.
There are dharmas possessed by the once-returner that are not included in the fruit of once-returning.
Namely:

The advanced uncontaminated roots, etc., and conditioned dharmas attained by the once-returner, as well as the destruction of all bonds realized by him, and the uncontaminated dharmas of non-analytical cessation possessed by the once-returner.
There are dharmas included in the fruit of once-returning that are not possessed by the once-returner.
Namely:
The fruit of once-returning that has not yet been attained or has been lost.
There are dharmas possessed by the once-returner that are also included in the fruit of once-returning.
Namely:
The fruit of once-returning that has been attained and not lost.
There are dharmas that are not possessed by a once-returner, nor are they included in the once-returner fruit.
This refers to:
Excluding the above characteristics.
If dharmas are possessed by a non-returner, are those dharmas included in the non-returner fruit?
Answer:
One should make four statements.
There are dharmas possessed by a non-returner that are not included in the non-returner fruit.
This refers to:

The conditioned dharmas such as the superior uncontaminated faculties obtained by a non-returner, the bonds exhausted that are realized by them, and the contaminated dharmas such as the non-analytical cessation possessed by a non-returner.
There are dharmas included in the non-returner fruit that are not possessed by a non-returner.
This refers to:
The non-returner fruit that has not yet been obtained or has been lost.
There are dharmas possessed by a non-returner that are also included in the non-returner fruit.
This refers to:
The non-returner fruit that has been obtained and not lost.
There are dharmas that are neither possessed by a non-returner nor included in the non-returner fruit.
This refers to:
Excluding the above characteristics.
Are all dharmas that an arhat possesses included in the arhat fruit?
Answer:
One should make four sentences.
There are dharmas that an arhat possesses but are not included in the arhat fruit.
Namely:
The non-discriminative cessation and contaminated dharmas accomplished by an arhat.
There are dharmas included in the arhat fruit but not possessed by an arhat.
Namely:
The arhat fruit that has not yet been obtained or has been lost.
There are dharmas that an arhat possesses and are also included in the arhat fruit.
Namely:
The arhat fruit that has been obtained and not lost.
There are dharmas that are neither possessed by an arhat nor included in the arhat fruit.
Namely:
Excluding the above characteristics.
Do all those who die in the desire realm and are reborn in the desire realm receive a desire existence?
Answer:
One should make four sentences.
There are those who die in the desire realm and are reborn, but do not receive a desire existence.
Namely:
Falling from the desire realm, giving rise to the intermediate existence of the form realm.
There is a case of rebirth in the desire realm that is not death in the desire realm and rebirth in the desire realm.
This refers to:
Death in the form realm and the arising of the intermediate existence of the desire realm.
There is a case of death in the desire realm and rebirth in the desire realm, and also rebirth in the desire realm.
This refers to:
Death in the desire realm and the arising of the intermediate existence and birth existence of the desire realm.
There is a case that is neither death in the desire realm and rebirth in the desire realm, nor rebirth in the desire realm.
This refers to:
Death in the form realm and rebirth in the form or formless realms;
Death in the formless realm and rebirth in the formless or form realms.
Do all those who die in the form realm and are reborn in the form realm all undergo rebirth in the form realm?
Answer:
Four sentences should be made.
There is a case of death in the form realm and rebirth in the form realm, but not undergoing rebirth in the form realm.
This refers to:
Death in the form realm and the arising of the intermediate existence of the desire realm.
There is a case of undergoing rebirth in the form realm, but not death in the form realm and rebirth in the form realm.
This refers to:ğŸ”½Death in the desire realm and the arising of the intermediate existence of the form realm.
There is a case of death in the form realm and rebirth in the form realm, and also undergoing rebirth in the form realm.
Namely:
Falling from the form realm, producing a form realm intermediate state and rebirth existence.
There are those who neither die in the form realm, nor are reborn, nor do they receive a form realm existence.
Namely:
Falling from the desire realm, being reborn in the desire or formless realms;
Falling from the formless realm, being reborn in the formless or desire realms.
Are all those who die in the formless realm and are reborn, receiving a formless existence?
Answer:
All those who die in the formless realm and are reborn, do receive a formless existence.
There are those who receive a formless existence, but do not die in the formless realm, but are reborn in the formless realm.
Namely:
Falling from the desire or form realms, being reborn in the formless realm.
How many are there who die in the desire realm and are reborn?
Answer:
Four.
Namely:
Ordinary beings and noble ones of the desire and form realms.
How many are there who die in the form realm and are reborn?
Answer:
Three.
Namely:
Ordinary beings in the desire realm, ordinary beings and noble ones in the form realm.
How many are there who die in the formless realm and are reborn?
Answer:ğŸ”½Two.
Namely:
Ordinary beings and noble ones in the formless realm.
Are all those who do not die in the desire realm and are reborn not experiencing the existence of desire?
Answer:
One should make four alternatives.
There are those who do not die in the desire realm and are reborn, but do not experience the existence of desire.
Namely:
Passing away from the form realm, giving rise to the intermediate existence of the desire realm.
There are those who do not experience the existence of desire, but are not not dying in the desire realm and being reborn.
Namely:
Passing away from the desire realm, giving rise to the intermediate existence of the form realm.
There are those who do not die in the desire realm and are reborn, and also do not experience the existence of desire.
Namely:
Passing away from the form realm, being born in the form or formless realms;
Passing away from the formless realm, being born in the formless realm.
There are those who are not not dying in the desire realm and being reborn, and also do not experience the existence of desire.
Namely:
Those who die in the desire realm and give rise to the intermediate existence and birth existence of the desire realm.
Are those who do not die and are not born in the form realm all not receiving a form existence?
Answer:
One should make four alternatives.
There are those who do not die in the form realm and are not born, but do not not receive a form existence.
This refers to:
Those who die in the desire realm and give rise to the intermediate existence of the form realm.
There are those who do not receive a form existence, but are not not dying in the form realm and being born.
This refers to:
Those who die in the form realm and give rise to the intermediate existence of the desire realm.
There are those who do not die in the form realm and are not born, and also do not receive a form existence.
This refers to:
Those who die in the desire realm and are born in the desire or formless realms;
Those who die in the formless realm and are born in the formless or desire realms.
There are those who are not not dying in the form realm and being born, and also do not not receive a form existence.
This refers to:ğŸ”½Those who die in the form realm and give rise to the intermediate existence and birth existence of the form realm.
Are those who do not die and are not born in the formless realm all not receiving a formless existence?
Answer:
Those who do not die in the formless realm and are not born are all not receiving formless existence.
There are those who do not receive formless existence, but who do not die in the formless realm, and are not born in the formless realm.
This refers to:
Those who fall from the formless realm and are born in the desire or form realms.
How many are there who do not die in the desire realm and are not born?
Answer:
Five.
This refers to:
Ordinary beings in the desire realm, ordinary beings and noble ones in the form and formless realms.
How many are there who do not die in the form realm and are not born?
Answer:
Six.
This refers to:
Ordinary beings and noble ones in the three realms.
How many are there who do not die in the formless realm and are not born?
Answer:
Four.
This refers to:
Ordinary beings and noble ones in the desire and form realms.
Is there anyone who dies in the desire realm and is not born in the desire realm?
Answer:
Yes.
This refers to:
Arising in the intermediate state of the desire or form realms, being born in the formless realm, or attaining parinirvÄá¹‡a.
Is it possible to die in the desire realm and not be reborn in the form realm?
Answer:
There is.
That is to say:
Arising in the intermediate state of the desire or form realms, being born in the formless realm, or attaining parinirvÄá¹‡a.
Is it possible to die in the desire realm and not be reborn in the formless realm?
Answer:
There is.
That is to say:
Arising in the intermediate state of the desire or form realms, or attaining parinirvÄá¹‡a.
Is it possible to die in the form realm and not be reborn in the form realm?
Answer:
There is.
That is to say:
Arising in the intermediate state of the desire or form realms, being born in the formless realm, or attaining parinirvÄá¹‡a.
Is it possible to die in the form realm and not be reborn in the desire realm?
Answer:
There is.
That is to say:
Arising in the intermediate state of the desire or form realms, being born in the formless realm, or attaining parinirvÄá¹‡a.
Is it possible to die in the form realm and not be reborn in the formless realm?
Answer:
There is.
Namely:
Arising in the intermediate state of the desire or form realms, or attaining parinirvÄá¹‡a.
Can one die in the formless realm without being reborn in the formless realm?
Answer:
There can be.
Namely:
Arising in the intermediate state of the desire or form realms, or attaining parinirvÄá¹‡a.
Can one die in the formless realm without being reborn in the desire realm?
Answer:
There can be.
Namely:
Arising in the intermediate state of the desire or form realms, being reborn in the formless realm, or attaining parinirvÄá¹‡a.
Can one die in the formless realm without being reborn in the form realm?
Answer:
There can be.
Namely:
Arising in the intermediate state of the desire or form realms, being reborn in the formless realm, or attaining parinirvÄá¹‡a.
How many are there who die in the desire realm but are not reborn in the desire realm?
Answer:
Six.
Namely:
Ordinary beings and noble ones of the three realms.
How many are there who die in the desire realm but are not reborn in the form realm?
Answer:
Six.
Namely:
Ordinary beings and sages in the three realms.
How many are there who die in the desire realm but are not reborn in the formless realm?
Answer:
Four.
Namely,
ordinary beings and sages in the desire and form realms.
How many are there who die in the form realm but are not reborn in the form realm?
Answer:
Five.
Namely,
ordinary beings in the desire realm, and ordinary beings and sages in the form and formless realms.
How many are there who die in the form realm but are not reborn in the desire realm?
Answer:
Five.
Namely,
ordinary beings in the desire realm, and ordinary beings and sages in the form and formless realms.
How many are there who die in the form realm but are not reborn in the formless realm?
Answer:
Three.
Namely,
ordinary beings in the desire realm, and ordinary beings and sages in the form realm.
How many are there who die in the formless realm but are not reborn in the formless realm?
Answer:
Two.
Namely,
Ordinary beings in the desire and form realms.
How many are there who die in the formless realm and are not reborn in the desire realm?
Answer:
Four.
Namely:
Ordinary beings and noble ones in the formless realm, and ordinary beings in the desire and form realms.
How many are there who die in the formless realm and are not reborn in the form realm?
Answer:
Four.
Namely:
Ordinary beings and noble ones in the formless realm, and ordinary beings in the desire and form realms.
Can there be those who die in the desire realm and are not reborn in the three realms?
Answer:
There can be.
Namely:
Arising in the intermediate state of the desire or form realms, or attaining parinirvÄá¹‡a.
Can there be those who die in the form realm and are not reborn in the three realms?
Answer:
There can be.
Namely:
Arising in the intermediate state of the desire or form realms, or attaining parinirvÄá¹‡a.
Can there be those who die in the formless realm and are not reborn in the three realms?
Answer:
There can be.
Namely:
Arising in the intermediate state of the desire or form realms, or attaining parinirvÄá¹‡a.
How many are there who die in the desire realm and are not reborn in the three realms?
Answer:
Four.
Namely,
ordinary beings and noble ones of the desire and form realms.
How many are there who die in the form realm and are not reborn in the three realms?
Answer:
Three.
Namely,
ordinary beings of the desire realm,
and ordinary beings and noble ones of the form realm.
How many are there who die in the formless realm and are not reborn in the three realms?
Answer:ğŸ”½Two.
Namely,
ordinary beings of the desire and form realms.
Can there be those who have not yet eliminated desire realm defilements, yet at death are not reborn in the desire realm?
Answer:
There can be.
Namely,
arising in the desire realm intermediate state.
Can there be those who have not yet eliminated form realm defilements, yet at death are not reborn in the desire or form realms?
Answer:
There can be.
Namely,
arising in the desire or form realm intermediate states.
Can there be those who have not yet eliminated the defilements of the formless realm, and who die without being reborn in the three realms?
Answer:
There are.
This refers to:
arousing the intermediate state of existence of the desire and form realms.
For those who have not yet eliminated the defilements of desire, how many are there who die without being reborn in the desire realm?
Answer:
Two.
This refers to:
ordinary beings and noble ones in the desire realm.
For those who have not yet eliminated the defilements of form, how many are there who die without being reborn in the desire or form realms?
Answer:
Four.
This refers to:
ordinary beings and noble ones in the desire and form realms.
For those who have not yet eliminated the defilements of the formless realm, how many are there who die without being reborn in the three realms?
Answer:
Four.
This refers to:
ordinary beings and noble ones in the desire, form, and formless realms.
Among them, how many latent tendencies increase in ordinary beings and noble ones in the desire realm?
How many bonds bind them?
Answer:
For ordinary beings, ninety-eight latent tendencies increase, and nine bonds bind them.
The ten latent afflictions of the noble ones increase, and they are bound by six fetters.
How many latent afflictions increase in the form realm for ordinary beings and noble ones?
How many fetters do they have?
The answer is:
Ordinary beings have the increase of sixty-two latent afflictions and are bound by six fetters.
Noble ones have the increase of six latent afflictions and are bound by three fetters.
How many latent afflictions increase in the formless realm for ordinary beings and noble ones?
How many fetters do they have?
The answer is:
Ordinary beings have the increase of thirty-one latent afflictions and are bound by six fetters.
Noble ones have the increase of three latent afflictions and are bound by three fetters.
The forty-two that increase, the two conditions, the uninterrupted existence,
The faculties, the accomplishment, the unknown, the realization - may this chapter be fully explained.

As for the latent afflictions of the eye faculty up to the latent afflictions of ignorance to be eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm, how many latent afflictions increase in each of the ninety-eight latent afflictions?
Answer:
The eye faculty is increased by the latent afflictions of the desire and form realms,
and by the latent afflictions to be eliminated by cultivation.
The ear, nose, tongue, and body faculties are also like this.
The female faculty is increased by the latent afflictions of the desire realm,
and by the latent afflictions to be eliminated by cultivation.
The male and suffering faculties are also like this.
The life faculty is increased by the latent afflictions of the three realms, and by the latent afflictions to be eliminated by cultivation.
The five faculties such as faith are also like this.
The mind faculty is increased by all latent afflictions.
The equanimity faculty is also like this.
The pleasure faculty is increased by all in the form realm and by the latent afflictions of the desire realm that are universal,
and by the latent afflictions to be eliminated by cultivation.
The faculty of joy is related to all in the form realm and in the desire realm,
except for doubt and ignorance associated with it that take the pure as their object.
The remaining all proclivities increase it.
The faculty of sorrow is related to all proclivities in the desire realm.
The three pure faculties are not related to any proclivities.
The eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, form, sound, and touch faculties, and the eye, ear, and body consciousness elements are related to the universal proclivities of the desire and form realms,
and to the proclivities eliminated by cultivation.

The eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body faculties, the form, sound, and touch objects, the form aggregate, the form clinging aggregate, and the first five elements, as well as the phenomena of form, visibility, and resistance, are also like this.
The nose and tongue consciousness elements are related to the universal proclivities of the desire realm,
and to the proclivities eliminated by cultivation.
The nose and tongue objects are also like this.
The mental faculty, the dharma realm, and the mental consciousness realm are all increased by the latent afflictions.

The mental faculty, the dharma base, the last four aggregates, the last four appropriated aggregates, the consciousness realm, the formless, the invisible, the unimpeded, the contaminated, the conditioned dharmas, the past, future, and present, and the dharmas neither to be learned nor unlearned are also like this.
The uncontaminated and unconditioned dharmas are not increased by the latent afflictions.
The dharmas of learning, non-learning, and elimination are also like this.
The wholesome and the eliminated by cultivation dharmas are increased by the universal contaminants of the three realms.
And the latent afflictions eliminated by cultivation.
The unwholesome and the dharmas bound to the desire realm are increased by all the latent afflictions of the desire realm.
The indeterminate dharmas of the form and formless realms, and the two parts of the desire realm,
are increased by the latent afflictions eliminated by seeing the truth of accumulation and the universal contaminants.
The dharmas bound to the form realm are increased by all the latent afflictions of the form realm.
The dharmas associated with the formless realm are increased by all the latent tendencies of the formless realm.
The dharmas to be eliminated by insight are increased by all the latent tendencies to be eliminated by insight.
The truths of suffering and of the origin are increased by all the latent tendencies.
The truths of cessation and of the path are not increased by any latent tendencies.

The cognition of dharmas, of subsequent cognition, of the truth of suffering, of the truth of the origin, of the truth of cessation, and of the truth of the path, and the three samÄdhis are also like this.
The four meditations are increased by all the latent tendencies of the form realm.
The four immeasurables are increased by the pervasive and those to be eliminated by cultivation of the form realm.
The first three liberations, the eight spheres of mastery, the first eight universal bases, and the cognition of others' minds are also like this.
The four formless [concentrations] are increased by all the latent tendencies of the formless realm.
The last five liberations.
The last two universal bases are increased by the pervasive and those to be eliminated by cultivation of the formless realm.
Conventional knowledge - all proclivities except for those with pure objects and views increase.
The three concentrations - the universal proclivities of the three realms and those eliminated by cultivation increase.
The fetter of the view of the self - all those eliminated by seeing suffering and the universal proclivities eliminated by seeing the origin increase.
The fetter of the lower part of the view of the self and the view of the self and extreme view - also like this.

The fetter of clinging to precepts and vows - all those eliminated by seeing suffering and the universal proclivities eliminated by seeing the origin, and the proclivities with impure objects eliminated by seeing the path increase.
Clinging to precepts and vows and the fetter of clinging to precepts and vows, the fetter of clinging to precepts and vows, and the fetter of clinging to precepts and vows - also like this.
The fetter of doubt - the proclivities with impure objects eliminated by seeing [the truths] and the ignorance associated with doubt that has pure objects increase.
The fetter of the lower part of doubt, the latent tendency of doubt, and the fetter of doubt - also like this.
The unwholesome roots of greed and hatred are increased by the latent tendencies that have as their object the contaminated factors of the desire realm.

The unwholesome roots of greed and hatred are increased by the fetters of covetousness and ill-will, the hindrances of sensual desire and ill-will, the fetters of sensual desire and ill-will, the lower fetters of sensual desire and ill-will, the two unwholesome latent afflictions, and the fetter of anger.
The unwholesome root of delusion is increased by all the latent afflictions in the desire realm except for the ignorance associated with the pure [truths].
The desire realm is increased by all the latent afflictions in the desire realm.
The desire flood, yoke, grasping, and the hindrances of sloth and torpor and restlessness are also like this.
The existence realm is increased by all the latent afflictions in the form and formless realms.
The existence flood, yoke, and self-theory grasping are also like this.
The ignorance realm is increased by all the latent afflictions except for the ignorance associated with the pure [truths].
The ignorance flood, yoke, latent affliction of ignorance, and fetter of ignorance are also like this.
